title: (x) bitmap face on Delta.inc website - Fuse Seven {Frank S}
content:
Hoover over any image.  
 [http://www.deltainc.nl/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120085311/http:/www.deltainc.nl/ "http://www.deltainc.nl/")

What’s the font? Thanks thanks!

 [‹ (x) Enjoy Life, One sip at the time - Warnock {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120085311/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14883 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Eurica logo - Alwyn {Dav} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120085311/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14473 "Go to next forum topic")
author: NoDesign

comments.content:
Examining the swf reveals that it’s something called Fuse Seven Complete. No idea where it’s from. Google turned up nothing useful.

(N.B.: It’s “hover” not “hoover.” Hoover is something they do to rugs in the UK.)

Mark, In the back of the Big Yellow (FontBook) are a series of FUSE experimental font sets that are numbered 1 through 17. Apparently each FUSE set had a theme. FUSE 7 is ’Crash’ and had fonts by Tobias Frere-Jones, Neville Brody and 3 other designers. Nothing in FUSE 7 looks like the bitmap font that shows up when you hover over the images on the posted page.

I guess the conclusion is that FUSE 7 is not the same as ’Fuse Seven Complete’. It seemed like a promising connection. Sigh.

- Mike Yanega
Did they even HAVE bitmap fonts in the Fuse series?

Apparently not. That’s why I guessed that the ’Fuse’ name was a coincidence. I went and looked through all 32 pages of Bitmap fonts at DaFont.com and didn’t see any that duplicated this, although several were reasonably close. That might be worth doing, if a similar bitmap font would be OK.

- Mike Yanega

FuseSeven is a font availlable on Pixelyn.net  
 [http://www.pixelyn.net/typefaces.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120085311/http:/www.pixelyn.net/typefaces.html "http://www.pixelyn.net/typefaces.html")
